position.marginalia_text: Directiones significatoru[m], in suis proprijs significatis.

marginalia.translation: The directions of the signifiers, in their own indications.

position.marginalia_text: Debes aliter ha[e]c co[n]siderare q[uam] hic unde proponuntur / quonia[m] / si directio pessimia et mortifera venere[m] feriret, an nu[n]c, soror, filia[e] vxor [etc] pessimè se habebunt? imo potius [Alma[n]te] significatoru[m] o[mn]i[u]m super vna re directiones istas recipiet. vide igitur sup[ra] fo 26. et 84.v. et 86.v. in fine. Intelligit, pro tempore considerandos esse horu[m] locoru[m] dispositiones et dominos.

marginalia.translation: You ought to consider these things differently than they are proposed here, since if the most calimitous and deadly direction would Venus, whether now the sister, daughters and wife, et cetera, will handle themselves badly? Indeed, rather than [Almansor] he will guarantee those directions of all signifiers concerning one matter. See therefore above, folio 26 and 84 verso and 86 verso in the end. He understands, that for the time the dispositions and lords of these houses must be considered.

position.marginalia_text: Contra supputant alij a Saturno inchoantes deinde a ♃ &c

marginalia.translation: Others compute against the things beginning from Saturn, then from Jupiter.
Another argument regarding the signifiers of the houses.

underline.text: Quia uero difficilie fuit hoc scire
